[[1973â74 Mersin Ä°dmanyurdu season|1973â74]] |} The [[1972â73 Turkish First Football League|1972â73]] season was the sixth season of [[Mersin Ä°dmanyurdu]] (MÄ°Y) football team in [[Turkish First Football League]], the first level division in [[Turkey]]. They finished 11th in the league. President was Mehmet Karamehmet. Vice president was Sezai Sak. General captain was Necati Bolkan. Governor of Mersin Bayram TuranÃ§etin gave a speech before the game played on December 25th, 1972 against MKE AnkaragÃ¼cÃ¼, inviting fans to support the team. Coach was Turgay Åeren. Åeren completed first half and resigned after a home lost against EskiÅehirspor on 17th round. NazÄ±m Koka replaced him. In [[Turkish Cup]] the team was eliminated to [[Gaziantepspor]] at 2nd round. ==Pre-season== * 20.08.1972 - Kayserispor-MÄ°Y: 2-1. ==1972â73 league participation== [[Turkish First Football League|First League]] was played with 16 teams in its 16th season, [[1972â73 Turkish First Football League|1972â73]]. Last two teams relegated to [[Turkish Second Football League|Second League]] [[1973â74 Turkish Second Footbal League|1973â74]]. Mersin Ä°Y became 11th with 8 wins.
